definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]
(of a horse, dog etc) to sit back on one's haunches and refuse to be coaxed forward/(of a person) to brace oneself to resist being made to go forward/(fig.) to dig one's heels in

sentences.english: That morning, he woke up early and sat in meditation as usual.
sentences.chinese: 一大早起来，还是一样打坐，照常做修行的课程。

sentences.english: We simply used a mosquito net in the meditation hall.
sentences.chinese: 在打坐大殿里，我们只用一顶蚊帐。

sentences.english: He just does the important works such as: practicing of Yoga, Zen and meditation.
sentences.chinese: 起而行，练瑜伽，禅修，打坐才最重要。

sentences.english: When Bankei held his seclusion-weeks of meditation, pupils from many parts of Japan came to attend.
sentences.chinese: 盘珪闭关时，总有弟子从各地赶来一同打坐。

sentences.english: She had built a little hut for him and fed him while he was meditating.
sentences.chinese: 她给他搭建了一个小寮，在他打坐时给他送饭。

sentences.english: These days, exercise is my zazen.
sentences.chinese: 这些天，我用锻炼来代替打坐。

sentences.english: Mo smiles were empty meditation, convergence will be immortal hero.
sentences.chinese: 莫笑道人空打坐，英雄收敛便神仙。

sentences.english: John meditates for twenty minutes before he goes to bed every day.
sentences.chinese: 约翰每天上床睡觉前先打坐二十分钟。

sentences.english: Zazen is basically the center of Zen practice.
O-nami sat in meditation trying to imagine himself as waves.
sentences.chinese: 巨浪开始打坐，试图将自己想象为海浪。

sentences.english: The priest is trying to teach him how to meditate .
sentences.chinese: 这位住持现在正试著教牠打坐。

sentences.english: Each day, there is time designated just for sitting.
sentences.chinese: 每天，有专门分配用来打坐的时间。

sentences.english: He sits completely still, contemplating the nature of reality, free even of his own body.
sentences.chinese: 圣人打坐，冥想着现实的本质，超脱于肉身的拖累。

sentences.english: After you drink your tea, hurry back to the Chan hall and sit.
sentences.chinese: 喝完茶之后，即刻回到禅堂打坐。

definition: to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
to sit cross-legged/to sit in the lotus position
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
to relax with one's eyes closed
to practice Chan Buddhist meditation/to practice Zen meditation/to sit in meditation
